website_summaries.verdict: The best budget lifting strap that utilizes the whole surface area of the arm for better results.
pros: Lifting harness fits tightly over the forearms, spreading the load across more surface area than handle straps
Keeps the body positioned for more healthy lifting
Easy to adjust with the built in attachments
cons: Successful use of the straps largely depends on the arm length of the user

customer_reviews.title: Won't stop your spouse from being an Ass but will make lifting EASY!
customer_reviews.text: WHAT A BACK SAVER! Moving during a pandemic was hard enough. These made it easy for just 2 of us to move all furniture. They did not prevent my spouse from being an ass claiming they were a waste of money --till I showed him a 15 second video on how to use them!! He did digress and admitted they were VERY useful and made lifting MUCH easier! Yes, you heard that: HE ADMITTED IT!! Very sturdy, well made, and real back saver!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price: $19. 13 in 2017 Allowed me and ...
customer_reviews.text: Price: $19.13 in 2017 Allowed me and my wife to lift a full sized freezer up basement steps, across a yard, and into the Uhaul. Would not have been possible without this and the Shoulder Dolly 2-Person Lifting and Moving System. Holding onto the furniture can be a little difficult when we were unsure of which strap loop to put our forearms into. We just took it slow and said "hey, I don't have leverage on this side, let me put my arms into the lower strap." Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Klu

customer_reviews.title: NOT the Original Design
customer_reviews.text: What I received were NOT the original Forearm Forklifts. I have a pair purchased several years ago that are probably three inches wide and very sturdy material. These are narrower (two inches wide) and a seemingly more lightweight material. They will probably work ok, but they are NOT the original design.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C

customer_reviews.title: The Good: Great and easy to use for moving large/heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this product for more than two years and it works as described. The Good: Great and easy to use for moving large/heavy items around the house, preferably on the same floor. The Bad: Not so great for moving large/heavy items across floors or in ant incline. Better option when the need to move items across floors iswhere the weight is distributed to the shoulders and back instead of the forearms.
customer_reviews.author: Rachk426

customer_reviews.title: A must for moving large or heavy furniture
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I decided to purchase a set to load and unload furniture into storage. We have a 10" height difference and it was just the two of us. I had no idea how we were going to lift our sectional sofa without destroying it. We purchased the extender strap along with the Forearm Forklift. They worked great for the sectional sofa, but you don't need the extender to move everything. We used the FF on three separate moving occasions and they've held up great. Works for oversized furniture, heavy dressers, tall bookshelves and mattress and box springs. Navigating inclines and stairs was a bit tricky. But moving without the straps would have been a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Harder than just moving it by hand
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these seeing I am not a young man anymore. Ordered them, they arrived quickly. Appear to be made well, little on the short side if you are taller than average. Tried to use them with a friend to move a few things so we could paint. Forget about. Easier to just manhandle the furniture to move it. Moving something like a long dresser it tips and you struggle to keep your elbows locked while trying to balance it. I simply found them completely useless for moving anything. However, they work well for wrapping hose and extension cords and handing them from a hook in the garage, so there that.
customer_reviews.author: Biggie's Equipment

customer_reviews.title: A must for moving
customer_reviews.text: I have moved 7 times in 8 years. And only on this last move did I finally convince my husband to buy these and fore-go movers. Let's just say he still hasn't recovered from the onslaught of "I told you so". I'm normal height, weigh 125 lbs and have no muscles at all. My husband and I moved our couch, washer and dryer, two huge dinning tables, a credenza and a dresser with no extra help. I didn't have to strain, I wasn't out of breath and I didn't hurt myself. It actually made me feel super strong. Honestly, buy these they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: YogiKat

customer_reviews.title: VERY Strenuous on Inner Arms
customer_reviews.text: I used this product with my husband to move abnormally heavy bedroom furniture out to garage to refinish. These arm strap do work, however the stress that they put on your inner lower arms can be very damaging. I have mini tears in the tendons from using these and putting too much load on my arms. To move the furniture back into the house I could not use these straps as my arms are injured. I used shoulder straps and criss crossed the bottom to secure. That worked with no shoulder damage. I would not recommend these over shoulder straps as they do work technically but the load can overwhelm your arms.
customer_reviews.author: AM Michaelis

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger
customer_reviews.text: If you're not fortunate enough to spend two hours in the gym every day with a significant portion of your diet composed of chicken breast, protein powder, and steamed broccoli, moving large objects poses an especially difficult challenge, even with a helpful friend. These lifting straps helped change the experience of moving one large shelving unit from a hernia/crush risk to nothing beyond lifting a sack of rice. The fluorescent orange color makes the straps easy to see when maneuvering, and the individual strap width is sufficient enough to cradle large objects without a real risk of instability. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jafar Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Straps allow more ergonomic lifting and moving
customer_reviews.text: These straps work well to move heavy or unwieldy objects. They can be uncomfortable on the forearms, especially if not located close to the elbow. My wife and found it best to locate the straps as far up on the forearms as possible. When used properly, the straps encourage use of good body mechanics - bending the knees, keeping the back straight and lifting with the legs. The straps will not work in all circumstances but are an important addition to our moving arsenal. We found YouTube video instruction in the use of the straps helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just OK
customer_reviews.text: We tried using these and found that it was still difficult to lift. We bought a more expensive belt system that uses your shoulders and everyone loved that. I would suggest that if you are just moving a few lighter things, the forearm lifting straps should work. But if you are lifting refrigerators and couches you might want to check for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, not great for moving
customer_reviews.text: These came just as described, so I didn’t take off too many stars. However, we used these during moving and they were incredibly unhelpful. It seems like a great idea, but the practicality of getting things down stairs, through the house and/or garage, up on to a truck, and into a place... these are more inconvenient than they are convenient. These straps are very slick too, so for the few feet we used them, I was so worried they’d fall off. If you happen to be moving something very heavy, over a completely flat area, these will help immensely. If you try to use these for moving homes, they’re not entirely useful.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S

customer_reviews.title: Totally worked. We used these to move several refrigerators ...
customer_reviews.text: Totally worked. We used these to move several refrigerators. Although the picture of the ladies moving the couch is cute, it's misleading. You will have your grunt-face on as you move things.
customer_reviews.author: The Allergy Chef

customer_reviews.title: Straps allow two people to move heavy objects through tight doorways or up stairs
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were a bit longer, it has multiple loops for different heights but all even in the highest loop, it requires you to pick the object up at least 16" off the ground. Great for moving up stairs but in our scenario, we were moving a refrigerator in a room with low ceiling fans and the choice to carry it closer to the ground would have been nice. Overall, not disappointed in the furniture straps and will recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: J White

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving easier!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I (I consider myself a tough, petite woman) were able to move our 20 year old refrigerator that I swear weights 500lbs. After a little trial and error, we figured it out. Make sure that bands are even on all sides before lifting and LIFT WITH YOUR LEGS. I bruise easily and I unfortunately got a few bruises on my forearms but nothing horrible. It did make it MUCH easier to move the refrigerator down 2 stairs however let the stronger person take the back end while going down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: ACP

customer_reviews.title: Product is Fabulous!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, saved my poor back from breaking as I recently moved into a new home. Make sure you get the right length for large products like sofas and hutch cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: good life

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving large furniture/appliances
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to help my parents move. They're older and I didn't want them to hurt themselves. My dad and I were able to pick up large furniture and appliances with ease with these straps. Moved a washer/dryer stacked unit without having to unstack them. The straps are easy to get underneath, have several loops to adjust the level of the item as you carry it, and allow you to maneuver the item easily. For what these cost, it would be silly not to get these for your next move.
customer_reviews.author: M. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Helps to have these
customer_reviews.text: Moved a front load washer out of a basement, up a hill, into a truck, up a flight of stairs with no problems. 2 people of course, lol. Used it for an old heavy wooden organ from one building to another. No complaints except that now there's no excuse to not move heavy furniture around 😕
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% Real Review
customer_reviews.text: If you see a review from me it’s 100% my experience and I’m only writing this because I read lots of reviews before buying something. These come in handy all the time. I have a moving company and my guys love these and use them all the time. They are well made and plain and simple work well and get the job done. Make sure you know what your doing and they are a life and space saver for sure. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving heavy stuff easier
customer_reviews.text: These are simple to use and very effective. Even though you are lifting the same amount of weight, these straps allow you to control the weight easier and safer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Healey

customer_reviews.title: Not As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This item is not as wide as standard moving straps. The over all length is about the same but width is at least more than half the size. The image on the packaging even shows the thicker version. Fabric is also cheaply put together. Looks like it'll rip if used too many times or whit every heavy objects.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Tully

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for heavy lifting at a great value
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to do any lifting of furniture, appliance, safes, et cetera, you need these straps! We used them for a recent move, and they worked on everything, including a 600+ safe. I even threw my back out the night before moving, and I was able to easily move our washer and dryer with these. They even make getting up and down steps much easier. They are worth every penny! Get the kind that has the back harness for extra support if you like, but these straps do the same job and work great!
customer_reviews.author: SaxyBacon

customer_reviews.title: So easy even a lazy lady can handle it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased these so we could move a chest freezer from our garage to our basement. Now, let me tell you. I avoid work like the plague. I'm not built for moving stuff. I came up with every excuse I could not to move the freezer. It was when these forearm forklift moving straps arrived that I knew I had lost and was going to have to woman up and help him move the thing. While I can admit, I won't be putting chest freezer moving on my resumé, these did work nicely for a moron who really has no business moving anything. So, if you're moving, these might just be your very best friend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a big benefit when moving heavy furniture.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very helpful tool. We used these to move a giant solid wood hutch and they were helpful - quite a bit easier than doing it without the straps. These are particularly helpful when you've got a piece of furniture that doesn't have a place to actually grab onto with your hands. My husband and I have about a foot of height difference, so these also made it easier to share the load. My only complaint is that I felt that they moved around a lot on my arms when I was initially trying to get them in place, and it was a little hard to get them adjusted right initally.
customer_reviews.author: Fi Fi Labonza

customer_reviews.title: Moved a treadmill down a narrow set of stairs
customer_reviews.text: I just used this to move a treadmill down a very narrow u-shaped set of stairs. I think that alone works as a valid review. Not sure how else I would have been able to pull that off without dropping it or damage the staircase.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t get them to work.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and watching online reviews I was convinced these were just what we needed. We tried them on a couple of things with different weights and heights but they kept slipping off and didn’t work as advertised. I really wanted these to work. I’m not sure what we were doing wrong.
customer_reviews.author: ER.RN

customer_reviews.title: This is a necessity for moving!
customer_reviews.text: This was a MAJOR lifesaver in our big move! We had so many heavy items to move in our house that these straps were a necessity! I’m in my mid 40’s and 5”2 and these straps were a miracle for me and my husband especially taking things up the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amieel

customer_reviews.title: The forearm forklift is awesome for two people moving mattresses
customer_reviews.text: The forearm forklift is awesome for two people moving mattresses. Especially the older mattresses that don't have handles all around. And besides, many handles just seem ready to tear apart if you use them for lifting and holding. I've also liked using these for moving traditional washers & dryers. Basically, if you're preparing for a move, get these and thank me later. A great friend and neighbor that had helped many people move, he turned me onto these. The man has a lot of smarts when it comes to moving and packing a moving truck, so right there you have two people that back these up full heartedly. Happy moving!
customer_reviews.author: Gisele

customer_reviews.title: Not Practical for Most Home Moving
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this and it definitely made lifting things a lot easier when conditions were ideal. The problem is twofold - the straps slip where they hit the item which make them seem less stable and they are not good for navigating down stairs or turning corners. If the item is narrow, they make it more difficult to carry because you cannot go to the side of the object easily. If you have heavy objects going over flat surfaces, I recommend. Otherwise, they were a waste of time/money.
customer_reviews.author: Just Left of Middle

customer_reviews.title: It works, and that's what counts
customer_reviews.text: It works, it's tough, that's what matters right? The multiple loops for your forearms are a nice adjustment tool, the lengths you get can be a bit awkward depending on what you're lifting with one option being too short for comfort and the next option too long, but that's the problem with universal tools like this. It helped me get a double vanity unit into the bathroom a lot more easily than carrying it by hand could have and it shows no signs of use after that, so I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Tank!

customer_reviews.title: Not advised for household furniture that is a beast to move.
customer_reviews.text: The straps worked great for items that were relatively light in weight (empty chest of drawers, single door refrigerators, and others). The straps were great for moving mattresses of all sizes. The extremely heavy items required 3 to 4 people (one on one end and two on the other end, or two on each end). I would recommend that these would be ideal for two males of equal strength and height. Overall would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HarperHamilton

customer_reviews.title: Adjust length of strap via loop on forearm, may need to readjust after test lift, for best control.
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought these years ago. I also bought the larger straps. Moved heavy funiture up flights of stairs , down flights using straps to carry weight while directing tilt with hands. I moved many prices alone. Reading negative reviews, it is clear that some folks have unrealistic expectations or have never moved. Having lived in at least ten places in 40 years, helped my kids move dozens of times, without these straps, hired movers for large items and I was stunned when I watched two regular guys move a grand piano using straps and a flat dolly and a ramp.No hydrrolics. .Clearly I missed the memo! Buying a second set.
customer_reviews.author: MKB

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as I Had Hoped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a Shoulder Dolly for a recent move. I found this item to not work nearly as well as the Shoulder Dolly. Something about it still using your arms to lift that limited the size of the load. It wasn't too bad for carrying boxes, but I ended up preferring use of a standard dolly/hand truck to do most of that work. I recommend you spend the extra money for a strap system that uses more of your legs and shoulders than this does.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: I cant say this helped or hindered my wife and i when we moved. Unfortunately trying to use these on anything that isn't tall and heavy is where you'll find yourself really struggling to use these.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great! But not so great for stairs
customer_reviews.text: We got these for a move and they helped SO much! I don’t know how I ever moved without them. However, they didn’t really help when going up stairs. We typically had to just pick things up the old fashioned way to go up stairs. Our mattress was the only thing we could use these for on stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, must have for moving!
customer_reviews.text: For moving big awkward furniture with 2 people this was a life saver! It definitely saved my back by dispersing weight more evenly. The various ‘arm holes’ were a big help when moving large to small items and if you and your helper are two different heights. I’d give it another star if it came with instructions or tips to using them more safely, trial and error was necessary to keep them from sliding off of some items, but otherwise a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Paiger

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Wrong with the Product...it just didn't help
customer_reviews.text: So my husband and I needed to transport an upright Piano. I bought these to help us load it onto a furniture dolly. I was hoping for an easy lift and then to place it onto the dolly, however even with three of my uncles help to try and figure it out we unfortunately couldn't get the forearm lifts to work :( We just all lifted it up by ourselves (4 men in total). Sadly we just couldn't get these Forearm Forklifts to help us. I was fortunate to have them there to help me. I've heard they work great (even by my uncle who helped) but not for moving a piano.
customer_reviews.author: Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Save your back for $20
customer_reviews.text: the only way to move heavy or awkward furniture or appliances. save your back for $20
customer_reviews.author: G. Stone II

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I moved 2 26-foot moving trucks FULL of items with these!
customer_reviews.text: Just my husband and I moved 2 26-ft moving trucks full over the course of 2 days. These straps helped us soooo much. My husband was skeptical they would work at first, but once he got the hang of them he admitted they kept us going and made our move possible with no help from anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Not as great of a product as I was hoping for. Just ok. Tried to move a desk with these and was disappointed. Basically lifting with your arms and nowhere to place your hands. I think if you are moving tall items like a fridge and could place your hands against the fridge these might work pretty well but I didn’t find them useful for shorter items. Quality seemed pretty decent though.
customer_reviews.author: Guesswho

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without them
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set as the first set I passed on to a coworker. At my advanced age, I'm not willing to struggle moving heavy stuff (let the younger testosterone kids struggle). I've found many opportunities to use them and anyone working with me are amazed at how handy and more comfortable moving awkward item can be using these straps. These are always in my truck ready for any moving task.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Fixit

customer_reviews.title: these made me feel like a superhero
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were a little skeptical that these straps would live up to all the reviews, but dang did they deliver! Just about everything we moved was manageable using the straps, even though my husband is quite a bit taller (I just had to find the right slot to put my arms in for better leverage). We went up/down stairs and ramps with heavy stuff like gorilla racks, bookcases, etc. The only thing we struggled with was a long desk with a center break between the filing cabinets, then we couldn't seem to get a good strap placement. Well worth the money for our move.
customer_reviews.author: bjanra

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing Would never recommend these nor buy another set.
customer_reviews.text: This product was not as advertised. Felt sub-standard in the material. The stitching was uneven and of poor quality. When using it to lift even a desk, the straps were unwieldy and just plain uncomfortable to use. I have purchased better straps from U-haul in the past and they have worked great.
customer_reviews.author: B. Allen Thobois

customer_reviews.title: A great tool to add to your home.
customer_reviews.text: In the right situation, these are incredible! I have found a few inconvenient situations for these - moving a mattress down the stairs, and moving a washing machine onto a pedestal (easier to just grab the handles on the washer). However, if you are just moving something from point A to B (house to moving truck) and there aren’t a lot of steps, tight corners, or stairways involved, these are amazing. Well worth the small cost, and a great thing for a homeowner to have around just in case!
customer_reviews.author: Ro Bot

customer_reviews.title: Felt like the items weighed half as much
customer_reviews.text: Worked great moving numerous heavy appliances and furniture. Little awkward for couches with heavy backs but evenly distributed items, fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: I'm actually super strong. I didn't know if you knew that.
customer_reviews.text: My confidence after buying these? Astronomical. Get them off your palms and wrists though! FOREARM is the pivot point of success here, people.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cusack

customer_reviews.title: Made it possible for me to move 12 rooms of furniture
customer_reviews.text: I have a motel and had to move 12 rooms of furniture after having new carpet put in. I am 75 years old and could not find any body except another old guy to help me move the furniture back. We were able to get the job done with these straps. We could move one room {2 queen beds, dresser, desk, small refrigerator, microwave, and night stand) in less than an hour. Would have been impossible without the straps.
customer_reviews.author: akboy

customer_reviews.title: Made me feel strong, even though I am not.
customer_reviews.text: I am a single 50 year old woman, and my 130lb son and I were able to move all by ourselves with the used of these amazing straps. Neither of us got hurt or strained or sprained. I HIGHLY recommend these for anyone who has to move anything heavy. They really did make fast work of our job. Even going so the stairs, no one felt like they were about to get squished under something.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Blue

customer_reviews.title: Works for some things but there is a learning curve!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for queen mattresses. Had trouble with moving couch because the straps were too short. Realized later that we could have reconfigured straps on couch and would have worked better. These have a learning curve and when moving time is of the essence so we didn't stop to take the time to work with these. They are very sturdy and comfortable on the forearms. Will keep to use when moving things around the house because I think if not rushed we could figure them out and they would be very beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Peeler

customer_reviews.title: If you pick up a lot of heavy stuff, this is the way to do it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest way to lift furniture or appliances. It gives you easy handholds and better support for your back. There are super fancy full body harnesses you can purchase if you're a professional mover or something, but if you're just a casual person that needs a boost, go ahead and pick this up for 1/4 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Shaker

customer_reviews.title: Don't Move Larger Items Without Them!
customer_reviews.text: These moving straps work as advertised. My daughter and I were able to easily lift and maneuver a 150 pound appliance up a few stairs, down a narrow hall and place it down in a tight spot. There are three loops on each end of the strap to get the proper length. They are a full 3 inches wide and made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: JPW

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t use moving a mattress upstairs. Too close to body and practically tripped up the stairs. Didn’t have the strength to hold up high enough to clear steps. Not useful
customer_reviews.author: Dave and Karri

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of these until I sold a piano online. It was so heavy the buyers would not have been able to lift it. A workman at my home drove home to retrieve these that he uses for the buyers to use. I was then amazed that two guys were able to place these under the piano and carry it out of the house and put it on a truck. This is a great product to save your back from strains/sprains.
customer_reviews.author: CBRN

customer_reviews.title: Why struggle, get these !
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd set of these, I misplaced the previous ones so I had to order more, can't do without them. They are great for carrying certain heavy items such as washer, dryer etc, although they tend not to work so well for carrying items up and down stairs because it's hard for the person facing downwards to keep a good grip on the item being moved. We like to use one strap between two guys to carry heavy mattresses on their edge, makes it 3.2 times easier, and going up or down stairs like this is much easier too. If I ever misplace this set, I'll be buying more !
customer_reviews.author: Naz Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Move like the pros
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved in quick succession. Our first, move we paid movers and noticed their straps for heavy and awkward items. It made perfect sense when we had to move again to use the same straps and it was a back saver. Mattresses, dressers, you name it, my kids were even able to help. For the price and the function, it's worth it to get these.
customer_reviews.author: Got it here.

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving awkward heavy furniture a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: If you have large, heavy, awkward furniture to move, especially with stairs...get these! I bought these because we had to move furniture up a set of very steep stairs through Bilco doors. These straps made moving the furniture a breeze. My nephews are very able-bodied and commented on how great these were to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Moving made easy
customer_reviews.text: Soooo helpful moving a 100lb stationary bike down a flight of stairs. We’re moving in a few months and I’m excited to see how these hold up.
customer_reviews.author: akeencloud

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Once you get comfortable using them it gets easier can hurt arm if not properly used correctly
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use to lift an armoir and an old TV. The straps were truly useless. We tried multiple times to use them and failed miserably. The straps are thin and cut into your forearm. My brother in law and I are not body builders by any stretch and both of us struggled to get the straps around the lower part of our forearms, the hole was not big enough. On top of this the straps were pretty stretchy making it extremely hard to gauge the length needed. They are also very very slippery. We ended up giving up and went with the old, just grab it with your hands method. Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: AJWKM

customer_reviews.title: Good for moving furniture
customer_reviews.text: By sitting home. I have time to paint my house. So, these straps helped me move furniture around with ease.
customer_reviews.author: A & M

customer_reviews.title: Always handy
customer_reviews.text: Good to have around for moving an entire household or for just relocating larger items within the home.
customer_reviews.author: Mistress Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not having to maintain a good grip on the outside edges of the unit allowed ...
customer_reviews.text: When I replaced my refrigerator I used these to move the old fridge out and move the new fridge in. Wow! These straps made a daunting task which kinda seemed impossible, actually possible. From lifting the fridge off the back of a pickup truck to maneuvering it up fairly delicate slate tile stairway steps and ultimately into the kitchen. Not having to maintain a good grip on the outside edges of the unit allowed for a much greater range of mobility and general safety. Ingenious design and the craftsman ship of materials used make these a reliable long lasting tool in your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: JBizzle

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I purchased them
customer_reviews.text: Last month the local TV cable news in my area reviewed whether the forearm forklift worked. They gave it raving reviews - which doesn't usually happen for other items they review. I just used them to try to move a stupidly heavy china cabinet. They didn't really make it significantly easier to move the cabinet, but they were helpful with getting the move done. I am glad I purchased them, I would just suggest managing expectations more than I did - my expectations were probably too high!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Good, Strong, & Well Made Product
customer_reviews.text: What I like with this lifting strap is strong, thick, 3" wide, & stitched well at different loop levels. The instructions is not very well written. The strap is supposed to cris-cross with your partner to prevent from slipping-out from underneath of what is being carried. This is a handy lifting strap and is a great addition in my garage for whenever I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the opportunity to use these straps three times now, and I can't say enough good about them. We were able to carry a very heavy armoir down the street pretty easily, after barely being able to lift it down a few stairs without the straps. We also moved a stove down a flight of stairs and through an apartment much easier that we could have by just using our hands. We are in our late 50's, so making chores like these easier is important. I had previously tried the straps that go around your shoulders, but they caused lower back pain. These straps did not.
customer_reviews.author: STX24

customer_reviews.title: Can last a long time. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on couches and my fridge. Nice and thick, great material.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful
customer_reviews.text: The webbing looked frayed when I took it out the package. Went to lift a washing machine and the webbing tore. I ended up having to use a dolly instead. I have used these straps before at work moving appliances so I thought these would be the same. The price was cheaper. I guess u get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Seuss Flores

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These worked pretty well for most of bbn our move. Stairs were still a bit tricky and they took some getting used to. We found that creating an "x" worth them kept them from slipping. Also you need to use lower loops than you think to maximize their benefit. I would give them 5 stars except sometimes setting them up wasn't worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: $eamStress

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but not very helpful. The straps are slippery and not that easy to move stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Incredible lifting power.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable how effective this was to pick up and move furniture around. I only moved a couple of large pieces around the house, but WOW! It was incredibly easy! The straps are thick and sturdy. The price is a bargain for how easy it made the job.
customer_reviews.author: TLH Review

customer_reviews.title: Works well with smaller items
customer_reviews.text: a little short for larger items. Once you situate these straps properly, they work well. We couldn't maneuver steps well with these straps, might have been because the straps were to short or us!
customer_reviews.author: Joe_OH.IO

customer_reviews.title: Mix feelings
customer_reviews.text: Mix feelings about the product maybe because I don't know how use it 100% or what but instructions weren't 100% clear either. It tells suggestions to what kind things can be moved and how to position the straps which is great; however with 3 atm holes my friend and I couldn't figure out if it matter so we played guess it. But we decided for moving stuff into the truck and unloading it was good. Going up stairs and down stairs made it harder.
customer_reviews.author: Cassy0104

customer_reviews.title: Sure Beats Using Muscle for Moving Heavy Objects
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sure takes load off of you. Should get longer ones next time.
customer_reviews.author: Carl W Spangenberg

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these, but I just found them to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, but I just found them to be awkward and was always searching for "the right application" to use them. No matter the piece of furniture it seemed like there is always a better option then using these straps. They seem good quality and I'm happy for others that find them useful, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewNC

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This was a must have for living our King sized memory foam mattress. Those mattresses are so foldy that it would have been next to impossible to move without. We ended up using it for moving other things since we had it and really felt it was worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Mills

customer_reviews.title: Just ended up moving stuff the old fashioned way
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of big stuff to move and thought these would help me so much! I’ve tried using them several times and it’s always easier to just pick it up the old fashioned way. The straps seem to be well made though!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Just awlful
customer_reviews.text: Looking to return as they kept slipping off the bed frame, they were no helpful and did not work as advertised. Extremely disappointed. Do not purchase them to help you get a person, friend or family member, you will be less stressed and less sore!!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Jacquette

customer_reviews.title: I mean we used it and did somewhat worked but I guess maybe it's her height or something that made it into an awkward position a
customer_reviews.text: So why the 3 stars? I think that the pictures are misleading or my girlfriend is so short that this thing doesn't work 100%. I mean we used it and did somewhat worked but I guess maybe it's her height or something that made it into an awkward position and it was not comfortable at all for her. I am average size too and not tall at all. I would still recommend this to use with my buddy and maybe it would become a 4 star but until then it stays as a 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DragonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Picks up easy objects
customer_reviews.text: So stron and easy to use. Perfect for picking up heavy objects
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good for it's intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to move a large flat screen TV and the TV stand that the TV will sit on. The moving straps work well for these purposes. I really like that you can lift with your arms while leaving your hands free for limited use with the component being moved.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, really help when use it properly
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product so far it had helped me to lift a lot things during a moving. I have moved mattresses, a heavy desk, sofas, and TV stand. So far have been easy to lift, and really help if you use it properly. Some friends try to use them, and use them wrong and they complain, but if you follow the insteu tons is fair easy to accomplish and you can avoid to injured your back.
customer_reviews.author: Raciel

customer_reviews.title: Great, but there's room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lifting straps to move some furniture and a large safe (about 150 lbs). They work great as long as you follow the directions. Tip: Watch the video in the product description several times before you use them. It really helps protect your wrists and hands from injury. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the middle section of the straps where the lifted object rests can sometimes slip, especially on smooth surfaces, causing the object to fall. This product could be greatly improved if there was a non-slip material sewn onto the middle section to grip onto the lifted object.
customer_reviews.author: Kona408

customer_reviews.title: Is it worth your life?
customer_reviews.text: Be cautious with these, while for smaller items they might be fine but they do not hold up to 800 lbs. These snapped on us while moving a wood stove and almost sent one of us to the hospital or worse.
customer_reviews.author: zbwoodwork

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 feet plus and these are short. Puts stress on the back. Also you need to have a partner who is as tall to have any kind of stability. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hurts on the arm
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 pairs for our move..we ended up not using at all because they were hard to maneuver. Didn’t work when we try using to lift the fridge..sliding out..hurts on the arm
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mattress Moving!
customer_reviews.text: Godsend for two fellows just trying to move out of a small apartment, even if only for mattress/boxsprings and that sort of stuff that doesn't have easy handholds. Pretty easy to get the knack of, so long as you take the time to read the instructions and use them properly, and worked fine even going up steps (slow and steady wins the race!).
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy/I returned it!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby and I were moving heavy furniture so I bought this. Big mistake! It was even heavier. We even looked at the video and it looked easy that's way I bought it. Woke up with my back hurting. Use a dolly or piano dolly that's the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Heavy object are no problem!
customer_reviews.text: These things make picking up a couch, table, washer/dryer 90% lighter and Very easy on the back - Note: longer walks with a heavy item can cause forarm pain/slipping but a quick adjust and you are good to go! Large/heavy items are still a 2 man lift but no need for 3rd or 4th person. I moved out of my 3rd floor apt to a house using these - Save tons of time and extra stability when using the stairs. 90% less out of breathe - let me take a break every 50 feet then you would with the 2nd or 3rd items. 3 Adjustable for-arm spots too!!! Note - best used with people that are the same height...
customer_reviews.author: jeremy d ellett

customer_reviews.title: HUGE Help!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were a lifesaver! We had a big move and myself and teen son had to do a lot of the heavy lifting (both of us are under 130 lbs). I don’t have a lot of grip strength in my hands, but am overall in good shape. With these straps we were able to move heavy objects with out taking constant breaks because our fingers are slipping (or just not strong enough). I strongly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: JGH

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving beds, other items???
customer_reviews.text: These are great for moving beds. We didn't find them as useful for moving chairs, couches, or other heavy objects. For beds, where a grip is sometimes hard to find, clearance under doors is hard, the mattress likes to bend, these are the only way to go. I am glad I bought them. My son will love them when he moves his king sized mattress upstairs to his master bedroom he is moving into today.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for move!
customer_reviews.text: The guys moving my furniture from the second floor to the first used them for all of the mattresses and furniture. They hadn’t heard of them but thought they were amazing! Have already shared the link!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing for moving! It’s crazy how well these work and I promise they work! Had my wife (115lbs) pick up and remove my 350 pound gun safe door with no issues! And carry our dresser up two flights of stairs! Crazy good!! Well worth your money!
customer_reviews.author: Seabass

customer_reviews.title: Great when you need them
customer_reviews.text: These are an item that you don’t use a lot unless your running a moving company but when you need to move a heavy piece of furniture they are a huge help!
customer_reviews.author: CLIFF

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t believe how my partner and I were able to carry heavy cabinets and a 9 ft couch. I’m only 5’4 and my partner is 5’10”. On some furniture the straps were too long so we needed to be creative in wrapping the straps around or we placed a leg in a strap opening and placed the strap over our shoulder. Once the furniture was lifted, the furniture could be easily maneuvered. These straps were definitely good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bassirian

customer_reviews.title: Back saver!
customer_reviews.text: Made moving heavy furniture from house to moving truck a breeze. We had no stairs so I cant tell you on that. My husband and I easily moved very heavy furniture that normally 2 or 3 guys struggle to move.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Huntley

customer_reviews.title: When used correctly - makes moving large objects 10X easier
customer_reviews.text: Figuring out exactly how to use them and place your arms etc... can take a minute but it is absolutely worth it. Made moving so much easier. I wouldn't want to move a couch or dresser without them.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Forearm Forklift
customer_reviews.text: We used the Forearm Forklift recently to move some relatively large and cumbersome wood working equipment from a garage workshop, into and out of a pick-up truck bed then down a flight of stairs into a basement workshop. The size & shape of the equipment is such that the equipment wobbled around a bit when being carried, however, the Forearm Forklift made this move extremely easy otherwise since we were able to lift the equipment using our forearms and to avoid bending forward in order to lift this equipment using our backs. The Forearm Forklift is well worth the cost and should be kept at the ready for these occasional heavy lifting exercises.
customer_reviews.author: DGL

customer_reviews.title: Of limited use, but well-constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind that if you are a little gal, with pitifully puny upper body strength, these straps are not going to make it any easier to lift the refrigerator. You still need a couple of beefy guys. But in certain situations, they do make it easier to manipulate larger, lighter weight, furnishings like a bookcase. What they will not do is help you to get something heavy down the stairs. They are for straight lifting and straight carrying applications. Having said that, these are strong, heavy webbing, well-stitched carrying straps. They are adjustable for varying heights.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: They really really do work, trust me
customer_reviews.text: I deliver appliances for a living and pretty much no longer use the big bulky appliance dolly, having to take the time to strap everything to the dolly and worry about scratching floors.. The only thing that we don't use these for is refrigerators, they're too tall and awkward going through doorways
customer_reviews.author: Jamie G.

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works...
customer_reviews.text: Sort of worked. We were able to pick up Heavy things like a mattress and large furniture, but it was very awkward walking with them. Lots of shin bruises. I think we would have had an easier time if we were physically stronger, as it was nearly impossible to hold things as shown in the commercial. They were helpful in moving a queen size tempurpedic mattress, so they get points for that. Completely useless for moving an empty freezer, even with the door removed.
customer_reviews.author: BmoreLabTech

product_meta.title: Forearm Forklift Lifting and Moving Straps for Furniture, Appliances, Mattresses or Heavy Objects up to 800 Pounds 2-Person, Orange, Model L74995CN, 2 Count
product_meta.description: Color:OrangeThis web page's offer CHANGES sellers AUTOMATICALLY. To avoid accidentally buying an inferior fake product, be sure the offer above reads, "Ships from and sold by . " If it doesn't, look under "Other Sellers on " and choose as the seller. IMPORTANT is that you have Forearm Forklift branded products when you move heavy furnishings. Forearm Forklift Lifting Straps are a pair of straps that are ergonomically designed to encourage proper lifting techniques and are OSHA accepted to reduce back injuries due to heavy and repetitive lifting. These straps employ leverage which makes the items being carried seem 66 percent lighter. This makes it much easier to go up and down a flight of stairs, and to turn around corners. Forearm Forklift Lifting Straps save floors from scratches, dents, scuffs and scrapes that dollies and hand trucks leave behind. They are adjustable up to 48 inches so you can easily carry small (SM), medium (MED), large (LG) and extra-large (XL) items. Forearm Forklift Lifting Straps are portable and they can conveniently be stored in a drawer, tool box, or under a truck seat. Forearm Forklift Lifting Straps are affordable, safe, ergonomically designed, adjustable, and portable.
feature_bullets: MOVES LARGE AND HEAVY OBJECTS MORE EASILY: Employs leverage, making the item being carried seem 66 percent lighter
ERGONOMIC: Designed to encourage proper lifting techniques and reduce back injuries due to heavy and repetitive lifting
ADJUSTABLE: Each polypropylene strap is 9 feet 4 inches long and has 3 loops at each end, providing up to 48 inches of adjustment to easily carry small through large sized items
